questions.name: When it comes to vehicular pollution, there is a need to understand why Delhi has an ever-growing motorized vehicle population. Efficient mobility is essential for a smooth functioning city. A primary cause for the explosion of private cars in the city is the _________.

options.name: Delhi’s vehicular traffic, particularly private vehicles, is not the prime culprit.
higher number of trips by autos and taxis and a larger presence of two-wheelers.
absence of a properly functioning, predictable, integrated public transport system with efficient last-mile connectivity.
a feeder system integrating the different forms of public transport, synchronized road management system, and improved pedestrian facilities.

questions.name: The real threat from ISIS is not territorial but ideological. The society that the caliphate has created is multi-ethnic, transnational, and fully conversant in the latest technology.

options.name: We may well look back at the first year of the Islamic State and wax nostalgic about how comparatively placid it was.

questions.name: It is important for HR and talent management professionals to understand the distinction between happy, satisfied employees and engaged employees. Engaged employees are happy, satisfied  employees, but not all happy, satisfied employees are engaged employees (………………………………………………….). Similarly, satisfied employees are happy to show up to work each day and do their work, but will be equally happy to take their satisfaction elsewhere for a salary increase.
questions.explanation:
The last point starts with Similarly and discuses about satisfied employee, at the end its says that BUT satisfied employee will be equally happy to take their satisfaction elsewhere. The use of Similarly shows that last statement i.e the blank also discusses something related to the comparison between satisfied and happy employee, the use of BUT indicates a difference i.e in the previous case the reverse of the said sentence will be true.
Option C fulfills both these points.

options.name: The renewed interest in improving employee engagement in organizations has originated from actions executives took during the recession.
Engaged employees speak positively about their organizations to their co-workers, potential employees, and customers.

questions.name: (…………………………………………………………….). The last sentence in the paragraph says about HR and talent managers to prioritize engagement. This shows a link between business leaders and HR managers and ther both are related to employee engagement.

options.name: Engaged employees feel emotionally connected to the organization, understand what it takes to help the organization succeed, and drive for that result.

questions.name: (……………………………………………….). questions.explanation: The passage is about stress reduction in employees. So the starting sentence must introduce this idea of stress. Option B and Option Eboth talk about stress. But Option E) relates it to work world, which is more close to the theme of the passage. Hence option D fits the blank.paragraph.

options.name: Mindfulness has roots that go back 2,500 years and uses an anchor—often breathing—to center attention and to bring awareness to the present moment
